Uses of Class
Model.Unit

  • Packages that use Unit 
    Package Description
    <Unnamed>  
    Model  

    • Uses of Unit in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Unit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void GameController.killUnit(Unit defeated, int x, int y)
      This method will remove the unit in the X,Y position if a valid attack is made
      void GameController.populateBoard(Unit[][] BoardArea)
      This method will be used only at the start of the game to create and populate the Board visualy with the Units based on the parameter that holds the actual Unit objects

    • Uses of Unit in Model

      Subclasses of Unit in Model 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      class  ImmovableUnit
      This Class separates the Immovable Units from the rest of the Units
      class  KnightUnit 
      class  LavaYetiUnit 
      class  MageUnit 
      class  MoveAbleUnit
      The MoveAbleUnit represents the Units that have the ability to move and separates it from the units that cannot.
      class  ScoutUnit 
      class  SlayerUnit 
      class  SorceressUnit 
      class  SpecialMoveAbleUnit
      This class represends the Units that are able to move but also have a Special ability (something extra) they can do
      class  TrapUnit 
      Methods in Model that return Unit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Unit[][] BoardModel.getBoardArea()
      Can access and return the whole game Board array that holds the Units
      Unit[] Player.getDefeatedUnits()
      Gets the player's Units that are currently defeated
      Unit[] Player.getPlayerUnits()
      This method is responsible to access the array that holds the player's units and return it as an array when called.
      Methods in Model with parameters of type Unit 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void BoardModel.fillBoard(Unit[] player1Units, Unit[] player2Units)
      Puts the Units given by the players on the board before the game starts
      void BoardModel.fillBoard(Unit[] player1Units, Unit[] player2Units)
      Puts the Units given by the players on the board before the game starts
      void BoardModel.removeUnit(Unit defeated, Unit[] playerDefeatedUnits)
      Once a unit is defeated it is removed from the board and moved to the players defeated units
      void BoardModel.removeUnit(Unit defeated, Unit[] playerDefeatedUnits)
      Once a unit is defeated it is removed from the board and moved to the players defeated units
      void BoardModel.setBoardArea(Unit[][] boardArea)
      Sets the board array to be the same as the array given as a parameter
      void Player.setDefeatedUnits(Unit[] defeatedUnits)
      Sets the array of defeated units using the given array of Units as parameter
      void Player.setPlayerUnits(Unit[] playerUnits)
      This gives the player its Units when the game starts and also updates its units when a unit is lost - defeated
